note.p: Birth: Condurrow, near Camborne, Cornwall, England (31 August 1800)
Education: British and Foreign schools, Falmouth and Plymouth. LLD (created 1859, New York)

Career: Worked as a farm worker and carpenter in Cormwall (from 1812); became a Wesleyan Methodist preacher (1823); became a builder (1824); went into partnership with his father-in-law, a manufacturer who later developed the 'miner's safety fuse'; Chairman, Cornwall Railway Company (until January 1864)
Memberships: FSA (1841); Royal Asiatic Society; FRSL; Irish Archaeological Society
